trigger.message: Hello there, I am a [canon] of St Andrews Cathedral.
A canon is a cleric who lives with others within a clergyhouse or cathedral. We canons spend our days holding [services], [scribing], and [looking after] the cathedral.
During services, some of us change into our more ornate robes before forming a choir. Services can be held in various [different places].
Most of the time we hold services within the cathedral itself, but sometimes we hold services in other local churches too.
Some of us spend a significant portion of the day in the [scriptorium] copying out [manuscripts] in order preserve the knowledge within them.
A scriptorium is room devoted to the copying of [manuscripts].
A manuscript is any document written by hand. They can be in the form of either books or scrolls. Some special manuscripts are known as [iluminated] manuscripts.
Iluminated manuscripts are enriched with pictures, border decorations, elaborately embossed initial letters, or full-page illustrations.
One of the duties we must carry out is to maintain the appearance and functionality of the Cathedral itself, including maintaining the grounds.
